overview: From 2025-07-13 to 2025-07-20, elizaos/eliza had 15 new PRs (7 merged), 9 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: When testing default plugins (bootstrap, sql, etc) get "unable to register again" error
topIssues.author: lalalune
topIssues.body:
When testing default plugins (bootstrap, sql, etc) get "unable to register again" error

To test: run 'bun run test' in any of these repos

This would be harmless but can be annoying with race condition on build for testing while developing

topIssues.title: @elizaos/cli test command incorrectly requires monorepo root for standalone projects
topIssues.author: sicco-moonbeam
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

The elizaos test command incorrectly assumes that E2E tests must be run from within the ElizaOS monorepo structure, even when running tests for standalone projects created with `elizaos create`. This prevents running E2E tests in standalone projects that are meant to extend ElizaOS functionality.


**To Reproduce**

1. Create a new ElizaOS project
```elizaos create my-project```

2. Run the e2e tests:

```npm run test:e2e```

3. Error: Could not find monorepo root. Make sure to run tests from within the Eliza project.

**Expected behavior**

The elizaos test command should:
1. Recognize standalone projects created with elizaos create
2. Run E2E tests in the project's e2e/ directory
3. Not require the full ElizaOS monorepo structure

**Screenshots**

N/A

**Additional context**

- Error is reliably reproducible with any "out-of-the-box" project created with @elizaos/cli

topIssues.title: elizaos start crashes after accessing localhost:3000 on windows
topIssues.author: paulmerz
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

As a newby (red flag hahah) I am just trying to get the agent up and running but cannot access the UI after the server built and I get the "Startup successful! Go to the dashboard at http://localhost:3000"

Here's the error I get in the terminal : 

[logs.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20780709/logs.txt)

Especially : agentName: "Eliza"
    logLevel: "debug"
[2025-06-17 17:28:26] DEBUG: Handling plugin request in the plugin route handler
    path: "/@vite/client"
    method: "GET"
    query: {}
[2025-06-17 17:28:26] DEBUG: No valid agentId in query. Trying global match for path: /@vite/client
[2025-06-17 17:28:26] DEBUG: No plugin route handled GET /@vite/client, passing to next middleware.
NotFoundError: Not Found

**To Reproduce**

Fresh install on WSL 2 on windows 11 using bun and the elizaos cli
- node 22.16.0
- bun 1.2.16
- elizaos 1.0.9

Follow the quickstart https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza

Put your openai key in the .ENV (or make sure it's there)

Run `LOG_LEVEL=debug elizaos start`

If that helps, I see no "public" or "static" folder which I usually find in a project that has a frontend

**Expected behavior**

I would expect to access the UI to chat with the agent

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/594d27e8-9edc-4550-a9bc-1ccbbe8c44f6)

I get a white page with the following errors in the console : 

:3000/@vite/client:1 
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)Understand this error
:3000/src/main.tsx:1 
                    
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)Understand this error
:3000/@react-refresh:1             
            
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)

topPRs.title: feat: implement service types and standardized interfaces with getServicesByType() method
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This PR implements the service types and test services system requested in issue #4914.

## Key Features

- **getServicesByType() method**: Returns all services of a specific type
- **Multiple services per type**: Support for multiple wallet services, PDF services, etc.
- **Standardized interfaces**: Created comprehensive interfaces for all major service types
- **Test services**: Comprehensive dummy services for all interfaces
- **Backward compatibility**: Existing getService() method still works

## Service Interfaces Added

- IPdfService - PDF processing, extraction, generation
- IVideoService - Video download, processing, conversion
- IBrowserService - Web browser automation and scraping
- ITranscriptionService - Audio transcription and speech processing
- IWebSearchService - Web search and content discovery
- IEmailService - Email sending, receiving, management
- IMessageService - Message sending and management
- IPostService - Social media posting and content management

## Usage Example

```typescript
// Get all wallet services attached to runtime
const walletServices = runtime.getServicesByType<IWalletService>('wallet');

// Get all PDF services
const pdfServices = runtime.getServicesByType<IPdfService>('pdf');
```

Closes #4914

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: feat: Add ElizaNet LiteLLM fallback mechanism POC
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This PR implements a fallback mechanism to the ElizaNet LiteLLM instance when primary models fail due to rate limiting or network errors.

## Features
- Automatic fallback to ElizaNet LiteLLM on rate limiting (429) and network errors
- Support for text generation, embeddings, and image generation
- Comprehensive logging and monitoring of fallback usage
- Configurable via environment variables and character settings
- OpenAI-compatible API integration

## Changes
- Modified `runtime.useModel()` to include fallback logic
- Added ElizaNet API handlers for different model types
- Added configuration options and error detection
- Created POC test script and documentation

Addresses issue #5438

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: feat: Implement CLI documentation coverage validation system (#5325)
topPRs.author: krishvsoni
topPRs.body:
- Add comprehensive CLI coverage validation system  
- Implement missing 'stop' command with full functionality  
- Create automated coverage checker script and test suite  
- Add GitHub Actions workflow for CI validation  
- Ensure all 12 CLI commands have documentation and tests  

This PR addresses issue #5325: TESTING: test all CLI commands against the CLI Docs.

---

### Changes:
- Add stop command implementation with process management  
- Create CLI coverage test suite (`cli-docs-coverage.test.ts`)  
- Add coverage analysis script (`check-cli-coverage.ts`)  
- Add GitHub Actions workflow for PR validation  
- Add comprehensive documentation (`CLI-COVERAGE.md`)  
- Fix path references in test files  
- Add stop command tests  

---

### Coverage Status:
12/12 commands implemented  
12/12 commands documented  
12/12 commands tested  
CI validation enabled  

---

## Changes Summary
Implemented the missing `stop` command with full process management  
Added comprehensive CLI command coverage validation system  

### Created `cli-docs-coverage.test.ts` for CLI-docs test coverage  
### Developed `check-cli-coverage.ts` automated coverage analysis script  
### Added GitHub Actions workflow for CI-based CLI validation  
### Wrote full documentation in `CLI-COVERAGE.md`  
### Fixed path references across test files  
### Added test coverage for the new `stop` command  

---

### Coverage Table

| Category        | Status     |
|----------------|------------|
| Commands Impl. | 12 / 12    |
| Docs Coverage  | 12 / 12    |
| Tests Present  | 12 / 12    |
| CI Integrated  | Yes        |

---

### Relates To
Issue #5325

---

### Risks
**Medium:** Any regressions in command behavior may impact dev workflows or user automation scripts.  
CLI command interface changes must be carefully validated to avoid breaking user expectations.

---

### Background
This initiative ensures all CLI commands are:

- Fully implemented  
- Thoroughly tested  
- Documented with up-to-date descriptions  

The coverage checker and CI pipeline enforce this going forward, preventing drift between code and docs.

---

### Testing

#### Where to Start
- Review `check-cli-coverage.ts` and `cli-docs-coverage.test.ts` for logic and output  
- Verify the `stop` command implementation and related test cases

#### Detailed Steps
- Run `npm run test` and `npm run check-cli-coverage`  
- Review GitHub Actions output on PR for CI test results


Discord - krishvsoni

topPRs.title: feat: implement customizable logger configuration for downstream projects
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
**Summary**

Implements customizable logger configuration for downstream projects, addressing #5183. This enables projects to customize root logger behavior including transports, formatters, and levels.

**Changes**

- Add LoggerConfig interface with support for custom transports, formatters, and levels
- Implement delayed logger initialization system to allow project-level configuration
- Add logger configuration loading from project modules and dedicated config files
- Support multiple configuration sources: project exports, package.json, and config files
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing environment-based logger setup
- Add comprehensive example configuration with CloudWatch, file, and HTTP transports
- Update CLI to apply logger configuration before starting agents

**Testing**

All existing tests pass and backward compatibility is maintained. The implementation has been tested with sample configurations.

Fixes #5183

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

completedItems.title: fix: suppress update notification during update command execution
completedItems.body:
The update command was showing 'update available' messages during execution due to displayBanner() being called without skipUpdateCheck parameter. This fix passes true to skip the update check during update command execution.

Fixes #5447
